sentence.text: Altogether, our data strongly suggest that mutations in cilium organization cause a previously undescribed clinical entity of a ciliary nature characterized by blindness and deafness but clearly distinct from Usher syndrome, a condition for which visual impairment is due to retinitis pigmentosa.

Cone-mitotic cell cycle checkpoint degeneration (positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) belongs to the disease spectrum of retinal degenerations, a group of hereditary disorders characterized by an extreme clinical and genetic heterogeneity.

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
